content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: --TPTREF
      operator: empty
    - name: --ELTM
      operator: non_empty
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.279
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Raise an error when --TPTREF is empty, but --ELTM is not empty
Outcome:
  Message: --TPTREF is empty and --ELTM is not empty
  Output Variables:
    - --TPTREF
    - --ELTM
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '279'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Time points can be represented using the time point
                  variables, --TPT, --TPTNUM, --ELTM, and the time point anchors,
                  --TPTREF (text description) and --RFTDTC (the date/time).; See also
                  --ELTM CDISC Notes in Domain Tables (e.g., "Planned elapsed time
                  (in ISO 8601) format relative to the planned fixed reference (EXTPTREF).")
                Document: IG v3.1
                Item: Specification
                Section: 4.4.7
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - FINDINGS
      - INTERVENTIONS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Raise an error when --TPTREF is empty, but --ELTM is not empty

Outcome.Message: --TPTREF is empty and --ELTM is not empty

Citations.Cited_Guidance: Time points can be represented using the time point variables, --TPT, --TPTNUM, --ELTM, and the time point anchors, --TPTREF (text description) and --RFTDTC (the date/time).; See also --ELTM CDISC Notes in Domain Tables (e.g., "Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) format relative to the planned fixed reference (EXTPTREF).")
